alert.note: Alert for Bell; Harlan; Knox; Leslie; Letcher; Perry; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 4:52PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Harlan, Bell, southeastern Knox, southwestern Letcher, southern Leslie, southeastern Perry and southeastern Whitley Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 451 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wallins Creek, or near Harlan, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Loyall, White Star, Elcomb, Sunshine, Teetersville, Baxter, Mary Alice, Liggett, Bledsoe and Martins Fork around 455 PM EDT. Harlan, Kitts, Harlan Gas, Clovertown, Golden Ash, Coxton, Chevrolet, Tway, Grays Knob and Lenarve around 500 PM EDT. Evarts, Kildav, Verda, Darkmont, Bailey Creek, Putney, Crummies, Cranks and Pine Mountain around 505 PM EDT. Dizney, Black Mountain, Kenvir, Colts, Short Town, Highsplint, Shields, Louellen, Nolansburg and Totz around 510 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Holmes Mill, Clover-Darby, Closplint, Lejunior, Black Bottom, Clover Fork, Rock House, Clover, Diane and Hiram. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Bell; Harlan; Knox; Leslie; Letcher; Perry; Whitley
